item.title: Plan to crack down on 'rip-off' university degrees
item.description: University courses will have to limit student numbers if they do not lead to highly-skilled jobs.

item.title: Extreme heat intensifies across south-west US
item.description: More than a dozen states are under warnings with the brutal conditions showing no sign of abating.

item.title: Iran's morality police to resume headscarf patrols
item.description: The controversial police unit enforces Iran's strict dress code and has been accused of brutality.

item.title: Lucy Spraggan: X Factor 'like abusive relationship'
item.description: The singer tells the BBC she wants to build better support for contestants on reality TV shows.

item.title: Twitter loses nearly half ad revenue since Musk takeover
item.description: Elon Musk confirms the firm has a heavy debt load and income in June was not what had been expected.

item.title: Government to miss 40 new hospitals target - watchdog
item.description: The National Audit Office has found the project is behind schedule and not delivering value for money.

item.title: Terror attack survivors condemn compensation body
item.description: The authors of a new report are calling for a change to how victims are compensated.

item.title: Fuel retailers urged to back government price sharing scheme
item.description: The energy secretary is asking supermarkets and petrol stations to publish prices to aid competition.

item.title: NHS consultant strikes: BMA announces two more walkouts
item.description: Senior doctors are already set to strike this week - but now they will also strike for two days in August.

item.title: Train strikes: When are they and why are they taking place?
item.description: Aslef train drivers are refusing to work overtime, while members of the RMT will walk out later this week.

item.title: Canada wildfires: Second firefighter dies amid record blazes
item.description: The unnamed firefighter died from injuries sustained working in the Northwest Territories on Saturday.

item.title: Australian sailor and his dog survive two months at sea
item.description: Tim Shaddock and his dog Bella ate raw fish and drank rainwater during their ordeal in the Pacific.

item.title: The Papers: Sunak's 'bad degree crackdown' and 'King Carlos'
item.description: Plans by Rishi Sunak to overhaul university degrees and Alcaraz's Wimbledon win lead the papers.

item.title: Huw Edwards: How Sun story about BBC presenter developed
item.description: The fast-moving story saw the dial shift on the balance between public interest, privacy and misconduct.

item.title: Banksy: What it was like to work for anonymous superstar artist
item.description: Gallery owner Steph Warren had a job at the "reserved" graffiti star's print shop in London.

item.title: AI Quiz: Can you tell which person is real?
item.description: Test your knowledge of the latest artificial intelligence developments.

item.title: Wimbledon 2023: Carlos Alcaraz beats Novak Djokovic to signal changing of the guard
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz beating Novak Djokovic to the Wimbledon men's singles title was primarily for himself - but it can also give hope to the rest of the younger generation.

item.title: How brands hope to tempt you with videos on labels
item.description: Companies are using augmented reality labels on their products to share videos and animations.

item.title: The 'QAnon Shaman' and other Capitol rioters who regret pleading guilty
item.description: Taking back their remorse could land defendants with stiffer sentences.

item.title: Mortgage rates: Six reasons why the pain isn't as bad as it could be
item.description: Mortgage rates are at a 15-year high, but there are reasons why the pain may not be as bad as it could be.

item.title: Britpop: What prompted the end of the genre that gave us Blur and Pulp?
item.description: Jarvis Cocker, Steve Lamacq, Jo Whiley and Damon Albarn share their opinions on the end of an era.

item.title: Your pictures on the theme of 'my hometown'
item.description: A selection of striking images from our readers around the world.

item.title: Spain's hot summer election: A simple guide
item.description: This highly unusual election takes place at the height of summer, after four years of left-wing rule.

item.title: Wimbledon final: Royals and A-list celebrities pictured in the crowd
item.description: The Prince and Princess of Wales and various Hollywood stars are watching all the action on Centre Court.

item.title: Entire pod of 55 whales dies after mass stranding on Lewis
item.description: Just 15 were alive after the stranding and vets had to euthanise the survivors on welfare grounds.

item.title: Ukraine war: Last grain ship leaves Odesa as deal deadline looms
item.description: Russia has threatened not to extend the deal allowing Ukraine's Black Sea grain exports despite the war.

item.title: Jane Birkin: Artist and style icon's life in pictures
item.description: France's president said she was a "French icon" who "sang the most beautiful words of our language".

item.title: Wonka film provides golden ticket for St Albans park jackpot
item.description: Parts of the Verulamium Park, in St Albans, were used in a trailer for the Warner Bros film.

item.title: Gelligaer: Ponies found in 'terrible' condition are rescued
item.description: The animals were "terrified of humans" when found but are expected to make a full recovery.

item.title: Tour de France 2023: Fan taking selfie causes crash on stage 15
item.description: A fan causes a crash on stage 15 as Wout Poels claims his first Tour de France stage win and Jonas Vingegaard maintains his overall lead.

item.title: Cornwall: Cameras deployed at Polzeath in crackdown on beach parties
item.description: A ranger says up to 500 people have been partying and leaving huge amounts of litter at Polzeath.

item.title: Swimmers injured in dolphin attacks on Japan beach
item.description: One man broke his ribs in what is the sixth such attack in the same region this year.

item.title: Harry Maguire: Manchester United defender stripped of club captaincy
item.description: Manchester United defender Harry Maguire says he has been stripped of the captaincy for the new season.

item.title: Call of Duty battle over after Sony deal with Microsoft
item.description: Sony agrees deal with tech giant to keep franchise on PlayStation as Activision buyout moves step closer.

item.title: Brother of Ronan Keating dies in car crash
item.description: Ciaran Keating died following a two-car collision while travelling to watch his son play football.

item.title: Women's Ashes: Nat Sciver-Brunt's century in vain as Australia retain urn
item.description: Australia retain the Women's Ashes with a dramatic three-run victory over England in the second one-day international at The Ageas Bowl.

item.title: US heatwave: 'Dangerous’ temperatures could set new records
item.description: Nearly a third of Americans - about 113 million people - are currently under heat advisories.

item.title: John Kerry in Beijing: Can US and China set aside rivalry for climate action?
item.description: The two biggest economies and polluters need to work together to avert the crisis, experts say.

item.title: Andre Onana: Manchester United on brink of signing Inter Milan goalkeeper
item.description: Manchester United are on the brink of completing the signing of Inter Milan goalkeeper Andre Onana for almost £50m.

item.title: Wimbledon 2023: Carlos Alcaraz fights back against Novak Djokovic to win thrilling final - highlights
item.description: Watch as world number one Carlos Alcaraz beats seven-time champion Novak Djokovic in a thrilling five-set match to win his first Wimbledon title.

item.title: Wimbledon 2023: Carlos Alcaraz says win over Novak Djokovic is 'happiest moment' of life
item.description: Carlos Alcaraz says becoming Wimbledon champion is "something that I dreamed about since I started playing tennis".

item.title: Women's Ashes: Australia retain Ashes despite Nat Sciver-Brunt's unbeaten 111 - highlights
item.description: Watch the highlights as Australia retained the Women's Ashes with a dramatic three-run victory over England, who so nearly pulled off a remarkable win through Nat Sciver-Brunt's masterful unbeaten 111.

item.title: Johnny Sexton: Ireland captain given three-match ban but cleared to play in World Cup
item.description: Ireland captain Johnny Sexton is given a three-match ban that will see him miss his country's three World Cup warm-up matches.

item.title: Scottish Open 2023: Rory McIlroy edges out Robert MacIntyre with 18th-hole birdie
item.description: Overnight leader Rory McIlroy sinks a birdie on the 18th to edge out home hope Robert McIntyre and win the Scottish Open.

item.title: Diamond League Silesia: Jakob Ingebrigsten breaks 1500m European record
item.description: Olympic champion Jakob Ingebrigsten sets a European 1500m record for the second time in a month at the Diamond League in Poland.

item.title: Mortgage rates: Five ways to save money
item.description: With interest rates rapidly rising, what do experts say about coping with costs?

item.title: Cost-of-living payments: Who is getting them and when?
item.description: Low-income households, pensioners and some disabled people will get extra help with energy bills.

item.title: Cost of living: What are your rights as a tenant when you're renting?
item.description: With one in five people now renting in the UK, it's important to understand your rights as a tenant.

item.title: Mortgages: What happens if I am struggling to pay?
item.description: Many homeowners are worried about higher mortgage costs, but lenders must help those struggling.

item.title: What is GDP and how is it measured?
item.description: A basic guide to how the economy is measured and what that calculation is used for.

item.title: How to get a job: Six expert tips for finding work
item.description: There are 10m people out of work in the UK, so if you're searching for a job you're not alone. Here are some tips on how to get started.

item.title: Cost of living: Five tips when asking for a pay rise
item.description: Recruiters, a manager and a workplace psychologist give their advice on how to negotiate for more money.

item.title: Debt: What do I do if I can't afford to pay?
item.description: What help and options are available to people struggling with debt repayments?

item.title: What is a recession and how could it affect me?
item.description: Britain's economy is expected to shrink in 2023 but no longer expected to go into recession.

item.title: What is the UK inflation rate and why is it so high?
item.description: The rate at which prices are rising remains high, driven by soaring food prices.

item.title: UK inflation rate calculator: How much are prices rising for you?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much the cost of living is going up in your household.

item.title: Mortgage calculator: how much will my mortgage go up?
item.description: Use our calculator to find out how much mortgage payments could go up for your household.
